title: Quantum Computing Basics
description: A micro-lesson that makes Quantum Computing Basics usable.

hook.text: A classical bit is 0 or 1. A quantum bit can be both at the same time.

buildup.text: Qubits use superposition to explore many possibilities simultaneously.

discovery.text: For certain problems, quantum computers could solve in minutes what takes classical machines centuries.

twist.text: Qubits are extremely fragile. A tiny vibration or temperature change destroys the computation.

climax.text: Quantum computers won't replace laptops. They'll solve specific problems classical machines can't.

punchline.text: Not faster at everything â€” just impossible things.

options: They can be both 0 and 1 simultaneously
